title: 96-Well Plate Consolidation
author: Opentrons
description: With this protocol, your robot can consolidate the contents of an entire 96-well plate into a single 2 mL tube using a p50 single channel pipette, with tip change every time. A CSV file containing volumes to be transferred from each well is required to be upload in the field below. Please see CSV format in Additional Information.
process:
Upload your volume CSV file.
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
Transfer appropriate volume from wells of the 96-well plate to a single 2 mL tube in well A1 of tube rack.
notes:
New tip is used for each liquid transfer. If you want to use one tip throughout the entire run, or change your labware, see our API documentation for tips on how to modify your Python script.
CSV file format (8 X 12)
no headers
each cell represents a well in the 96-well plate
volumes must be in integers
unit: uL

markdown.title: 96-Well Plate Consolidation
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description: With this protocol, your robot can consolidate the contents of an entire 96-well plate into a single 2 mL tube using a p50 single channel pipette, with tip change every time. A CSV file containing volumes to be transferred from each well is required to be upload in the field below. Please see CSV format in Additional Information.
markdown.process:
1. Upload your volume CSV file.
2. Download your protocol.
3. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
4. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
5. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support article](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-2/getting-started-software-setup/deck-calibration).
5. Hit "Run".
6. Transfer appropriate volume from wells of the 96-well plate to a single 2 mL tube in well A1 of tube rack.
markdown.notes:
* New tip is used for each liquid transfer. If you want to use one tip throughout the entire run, or change your labware, see our [API documentation](https://docs.opentrons.com/index.html) for tips on how to modify your Python script.
* CSV file format (8 X 12)
    * no headers
    * each cell represents a well in the 96-well plate
    * volumes must be in integers
    * unit: uL

![csv example](https://s3.amazonaws.com/opentrons-protocol-library-website/custom-README-images/96_well_consolidation_csv.png)
